name: Refinery Platform
body: ### About The Refinery Platform is a web-based data visualization and analysis system powered by an ISA-Tab-compatible data repository for public and private data sets. Analyses are implemented as Galaxy workflows and executed through the Galaxy API. ### News * __12 January 2016__ | The [Gehlenborg Lab at Harvard Medical School](http://gehlenborglab.org) is looking for a [data visualization software developer](https://sjobs.brassring.com/tgwebhost/jobdetails.aspx?jobId=1191244&PartnerId=25240&SiteId=5341&type=mail&JobReqLang=1&recordstart=1&JobSiteId=5341&JobSiteInfo=1191244_5341&gqid=0) who will also be contributing to the Refinery Platform project. Our goal is to build groundbreaking open-source data visualization software that are employed in cutting-edge biomedical research and drive scientific progress. We are looking for a highly motivated and creative individual with a passion for code, data, design, and biomedical science. * __20 November 2015__ | We are thrilled to have been selected for an [AWS in Education Research Grant](http://aws.amazon.com/grants/) award to support the development of a cloud-based version of the Refinery Platform! * __2 September 2015__ | The Refinery Team welcomes Scott Ouellette (@scottx611x) who joins us as a Software Developer. Welcome Scott! * __10 July 2015__ | We are presenting a [poster](http://gehlenborg.com/wp-content/uploads/refinery_poster_biovis-2015.pdf) about our provenance visualization approach at the BioVis 2015 conference at ISMB/ECCB 2015 in Dublin, Ireland. * __18 May 2015__ | We are excited to welcome two new team members: Jennifer Marx (@jkmarx) and Fritz Lekschas (@flekschas). Welcome Jennifer and Fritz! * __5 January 2015__ | [The Refinery Team is hiring](https://jobs.brassring.com/tgwebhost/jobdetails.aspx?jobId=1118216&PartnerId=25240&SiteId=5341&type=mail&JobReqLang=1&recordstart=1&JobSiteId=5341&JobSiteInfo=1118216_5341&gqid=0)! As part of an initiative with the [Harvard Stem Cell Institute](http://hsci.harvard.edu), the Park Lab is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic software developer to participate in extending Refinery Platform for the [Harvard Stem Cell Commons](http://stemcellcommons.org). The software developer should be comfortable with and be experienced in working on both server-side components (including compute clusters and/or clouds) and client-side (web UI) components, as well as modern software engineering practices such as automated testing and continuous integration/deployment. Our ideal candidate has experience in full stack web software development with a focus on designing, developing and maintaining production software systems in data-intensive settings, ideally for scientific applications. The [detailed job ad](https://jobs.brassring.com/tgwebhost/jobdetails.aspx?jobId=1118216&PartnerId=25240&SiteId=5341&type=mail&JobReqLang=1&recordstart=1&JobSiteId=5341&JobSiteInfo=1118216_5341&gqid=0) is on the Harvard HR website. * __9 October 2014__ | We are thrilled that the [Mozilla Science Lab](http://mozillascience.org) has included the Refinery Platform project in the 1st round of their new [collaboration program](collaborate.mozillascience.org). If you are an open source developer interested in contributing to a scientific software project you can check out a list of tasks at [collaborate.mozillascience.org/projects/refinery](collaborate.mozillascience.org/projects/refinery). * __7 October 2014__ | Guess what? Refinery is now on Twitter: [@_refinery](http://twitter.com/_refinery). Follow us for project updates and other important announcements. * __29 June 2014__ | Ilya Sytchev (@hackdna) participated in the [Galaxy Community Conference Hackathon](https://wiki.galaxyproject.org/Events/GCC2014/Hackathon) and contributed code to the Galaxy project that will allow us to cancel analyses running in Galaxy directly from Refinery. He also presented a poster on our experience in interacting with the Galaxy API. * __8 June 2014__ | Jeremy Liu (@jeremyjliu) from Yale will spend the summer with the Refinery team as an intern through the [MIT HST and i2b2 Bioinformatics and Integrative Genomics (BIG) summer institute](http://hst.mit.edu/academics/summer-institute/bioinformatics). * __1 May 2014__ | Anton Xue (@AntonXue) from Boston Latin School joins the project as an intern. Welcome Anton! * __1 January 2014__ | The Refinery project will be receiving additional funding through an NIH/NHGRI Pathway Independence Award to Nils Gehlenborg (@ngehlenborg). * __10 December 2013__ | In collaboration with Stefan Luger (@sluger) and Marc Streit (@mstreit) we have added a novel workflow visualization to Refinery that allows users to view and explore workflows imported into Refinery from a Galaxy instance. * __28 August 2013__ | Thanks to the efforts of Ilya Sytchev (@hackdna) from the Harvard School of Public Health team, we are now able to provide a _painless deployment strategy using Vagrant, Puppet and Virtualbox for developers_ and others who would like to test the system on their own machine. The setup is almost completely automated and details can be found in the [README](https://github.com/parklab/refinery-platform) in our GitHub repository. ### Talks and Presentations * __Test__, _Test 2017_, Test, Testland, Test 2017. [[Video](http://player.vimeo.com/video/43929942)] ### Media Coverage * __July 2013 - GenomeWeb Bioinform__, _At ISMB '13, BOSC Talks Underscore Value of Open Source Infrastructure, Data for Scientific Research_. [[Link](http://www.genomeweb.com/informatics/ismb-13-bosc-talks-underscore-value-open-source-infrastructure-data-scientific-r)] * __July 2013 - Nature Methods__, _Data visualization: ambiguity as a fellow traveler_. [[Link](http://www.nature.com/nmeth/journal/v10/n7/full/nmeth.2530.html)] * __March 2013 - GenomeWeb Bioinform__, _Informatics Applications for Pharmacogenomics, Text Mining Among Trends Highlighted at TBI 2013_. [[Link](http://www.genomeweb.com/informatics/informatics-applications-pharmacogenomics-text-mining-among-trends-highlighted-t)] ### Projects using the Refinery Platform - http://encode-x.med.harvard.edu | This is a site running the Refinery Platform in "repository mode". In repository mode workflows cannot be accessed (note that this is running an early version of Refinery). - http://www.stemcellcommons.org | The Refinery Platform will provide data manipulation, analysis and visualization capabilities for the Stem Cell Commons project (under development). ### Documentation Our documentation for Refinery Platform users, administrators and developers is available at http://refinery-platform.readthedocs.org. This is work in progress. ### Project Team The Refinery Platform is a project of the Park and Gehlenborg Labs at Harvard Medical School in collaboration with the Hide Lab at Harvard School of Public Health. #### Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School * Nils Gehlenborg (@ngehlenborg) * Fritz Lekschas (@flekschas) * Jennifer K Marx (@jkmarx) * Scott Ouellette (@scottx611x) * Peter J Park ##### Alumni * Richard Park (@rpark37) * Jeremy Liu (@jeremyjliu) * Anton Xue (@AntonXue) * Psalm Haseley (@psm3426) #### Department of Biostatistics at Harvard TH Chan School of Public Health * Ilya Sytchev (@hackdna) * Shannan Ho Sui (@sjhosui) #### Sheffield Institute for Translational Neuroscience at The University of Sheffield * David R Jones (@drj11) * Winston Hide #### Johannes Kepler University Linz (Austria) * Marc Streit (@mstreit) * Samuel Gratzl (@sgratzl) * Stefan Luger (@sluger) ### Funding The project is funded in part by an [NIH/NHGRI Pathway to Independence Award](http://projectreporter.nih.gov/project_info_description.cfm?aid=8633263&icde=19462221) to Nils Gehlenborg, an [Agilent Technologies Emerging Insights Grant](https://www.chem.agilent.com/en-US/promotions/pages/grant2.aspx) to Peter Park, by the [Harvard Stem Cell Institute](http://www.hsci.harvard.edu/research/center-stem-cell-bioinformatics) and supported by an [AWS in Education Research Grant](http://aws.amazon.com/grants/) award. ### Contact and Support Please create a ticket in the issue tracker or email us at refinery@hms.harvard.edu.
